issue.title: [C++] ArrayFromJSON can't parse Timestamp from strings
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-5040](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-5040). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
Currently, ArrayFromJSON can only produce timestamps from numbers.

This is an impediment for writing tests for JSON and CSV, since those formats parse timestamps from strings and it's not immediately obvious that "2000-20-29" corresponds to 951782400

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-5040?focusedCommentId=16804346) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
It seems reasonable to accept ISO8601-formatted strings here

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-5040?focusedCommentId=16854669) by Antoine Pitrou (apitrou):*
Looks like this was fixed as part of ARROW-4708

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-5040?focusedCommentId=17585863) by @toddfarmer:*
Transitioning issue from Resolved to Closed to based on resolution field value.
